text:
$$\Delta_G(u,v) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}
deg(u) & \mbox{ if } u=v,\\
-e(u,v)&  \mbox{ if } u \neq v.
\end{array}\right.
$$

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\Delta_{G}(u,v)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{ll}deg(u)&\mbox{ if }u=v,\\
-e(u,v)&\mbox{ if }u\neq v.\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>≠</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>

text:
$$\rho(f) = \left\{\begin{array}{llll}
	-1 & \mbox{ if } deg(f) \leq -1,\\
	-1 &  \mbox{ if } deg(f) =0 \mbox{ and } f \mbox { is bad},\\
	0 &  \mbox{ if } deg(f) =0 \mbox{ and } f \mbox{ is good },\\
	deg(f)-1 & \mbox{ if } deg(f) \geq 1.\\
	\end{array}\right.
	$$

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex3.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\rho(f)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{llll}-1&\mbox{ if }deg(f)\leq-1,\\
-1&\mbox{ if }deg(f)=0\mbox{ and }f\mbox{ is bad},\\
0&\mbox{ if }deg(f)=0\mbox{ and }f\mbox{ is good },\\
deg(f)-1&\mbox{ if }deg(f)\geq 1.\\
\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable text:
$$ \Leftrightarrow  \exists x: 
\left\{\begin{array}{lll}
            f_1 & = & 2x_1 - x_2\\
            f_2 & = & - x_1 + 2x_2 - x_3 \\
            f_3 & = & - x_2 + 2x_3 - x_4 \\
            \ldots\\
	     f_{n-1} & = & - x_{n-2} + 2x_{n-1}\\
	     f_n & = & 2x_{n-1} - x_1\\ 	
            \end{array}\right.
$$

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\Leftrightarrow\exists x:\left\{\begin{array}[]{lll}f_{1}&=&2x_{1}-x_{2}\\
f_{2}&=&-x_{1}+2x_{2}-x_{3}\\
f_{3}&=&-x_{2}+2x_{3}-x_{4}\\
\ldots\\
f_{n-1}&=&-x_{n-2}+2x_{n-1}\\
f_{n}&=&2x_{n-1}-x_{1}\\
\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mo>⇔</mo><mo>∃</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi></mtd><mtd/><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mo>=</mo></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: We define {\em zero} of $f$ on $H$, and denote by $f_{N(H)}$, the following divisor on $H$.
text:
$$f_{G/H}(u) = \left\{\begin{array}{lll}
	f(u) & \mbox{ if } u \in V_1 \backslash\{v\}, \\
	\sum_{u \in H} f(u) &  \mbox{ if } u=v. 
	\end{array}\right.
	$$
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex11.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="f_{G/H}(u)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lll}f(u)&\mbox{ if }u\in V_{1}\backslash\{v%
\},\\
\sum_{u\in H}f(u)&\mbox{ if }u=v.\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi>G</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>H</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>∈</mo><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>\</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>∈</mo><mi>H</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext:
\end{defn}
One has directly the relation between a divisor and its contraction and zero.
prevtext: We define {\em zero} of $f$ on $H$, and denote by $f_{N(H)}$, the following divisor on $H$.
text:
$$f_{N(H)}(u) = \left\{\begin{array}{lll}
	f(u) & \mbox{ if } u \in H \backslash\{v\}, \\
	- \sum_{u \in H \backslash\{v\}} f(u) &  \mbox{ if } u=v. 
	\end{array}\right.
	$$
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex12.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="f_{N(H)}(u)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lll}f(u)&\mbox{ if }u\in H\backslash\{v\},%
\\
-\sum_{u\in H\backslash\{v\}}f(u)&\mbox{ if }u=v.\end{array}\right." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>∈</mo><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo>\</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>∈</mo><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo>\</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></munder><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>u</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mtext> if </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>v</mi></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd/></mtr></mtable><mi/></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext:
Generally, let $U$ be a subset of $V(G)$ and let $H=G(U)$, we can consider a divisor on $H$ as a divisor on $G$ by giving value $0$ to all vertices in $V(G) \backslash U$. Similarly, we consider the matrix indexed by vertices of $H$ as a matrix indexed by vertices of $G$ by giving value $0$ to all entries indexed by vertices in $V(G) \backslash U$.

It is easy to check that $\Delta_{G
/H} + \Delta_{H} = \Delta_G$.

Nevertheless, the rank of a divisor on $G$ and on $H$ are not the same, that means if $f$ is a divisor on $H$ then $f$ can be seen as a divisor on $G$ but $\rho_G(f) \neq \rho_H(f)$. 


Now we show that the rank of a divisor can be computed from that of its contraction. 

\begin{prop}
	Let $G$ be a graph and let $v$ be a cut vertex which decomposes $G$ to $H$ and $G_1$. If $H$ is a tree then for all divisor $f$ on $G$, we have $\rho(f) = \rho(f_{G/H})$.
\end{prop}
\begin{proof}
	Let $r$ be the rank of $\rho(f_{G/H})$, we will prove that $\rho(f) =r$.
	Let $\lambda$ be a divisor on $G$, we have:

\end{defn}
One has directly the relation between a divisor and its contraction and zero.
text:
$$\left\{\begin{array}{lll}
f_G = f_{G/H} + f_{N(H)},\\
deg(f_{G/H}) = deg(f_G),\\
deg(f_{N(H)})=0. 
\end{array}\right.
$$

prevtext:
Generally, let $U$ be a subset of $V(G)$ and let $H=G(U)$, we can consider a divisor on $H$ as a divisor on $G$ by giving value $0$ to all vertices in $V(G) \backslash U$. Similarly, we consider the matrix indexed by vertices of $H$ as a matrix indexed by vertices of $G$ by giving value $0$ to all entries indexed by vertices in $V(G) \backslash U$.

It is easy to check that $\Delta_{G
/H} + \Delta_{H} = \Delta_G$.

Nevertheless, the rank of a divisor on $G$ and on $H$ are not the same, that means if $f$ is a divisor on $H$ then $f$ can be seen as a divisor on $G$ but $\rho_G(f) \neq \rho_H(f)$. 


Now we show that the rank of a divisor can be computed from that of its contraction. 

\begin{prop}
	Let $G$ be a graph and let $v$ be a cut vertex which decomposes $G$ to $H$ and $G_1$. If $H$ is a tree then for all divisor $f$ on $G$, we have $\rho(f) = \rho(f_{G/H})$.
\end{prop}
\begin{proof}
	Let $r$ be the rank of $\rho(f_{G/H})$, we will prove that $\rho(f) =r$.
	Let $\lambda$ be a divisor on $G$, we have:

text:
$$\rho(f) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}
	r & \mbox{ if } \rho(f_{G/H} - 2 \epsilon_v) \geq r-1,\\
	r-1 &  \mbox{ if } \rho(f_{G/H} - 2 \epsilon_v) = r-2,
	\end{array}\right.
	$$

text:
$$\rho(f_{G_i}) = \left\{\begin{array}{lll}
	\rho(f_{G_{i+1}}) & \mbox{ if } H_{i+1} \mbox{ is an edge, } \\
	\rho(f_{G_{i+1}} - \epsilon_{v_{i+1}}) & \mbox{ if } H_{i+1} \mbox{ is an cycle and } f_{N(H_i)} \mbox{ is bad,}\\
	 \rho(f_{G_{i+1}} - 2\epsilon_{v_{i+1}}) + 1 & \mbox{ if } H_{i+1} \mbox{ is an cycle and } f_{N(H_i)} \mbox{ is good.}\\
	\end{array}\right.
	$$
